conclusion: Determine the charge Q carried by the capacitor after the circuit stabilizes.
Resistors R2 and R3 are in series, so their total resistance is R23 = R2 + R3 = 9Ω.
Resistor R1 is in parallel with the series combination R23. The total resistance R_total is 18/11Ω.
The total resistance of the circuit is R_total + r = 40/11Ω.
The total current I is given by Ohm's law: I = 33/31A.
The voltage drop across R23 is V23 = I * R23 = 297/31V.
The voltage across the capacitor is V_C = E - I * R1 = 120/31V.
The charge Q on the capacitor is Q = C * V_C = 3.87 * 10^-5C.
The charge on the capacitor is 3.87 * 10^-5 C.
